author: Brian Heater
title: Microsoft names LinkedIn SVP Kevin Scott as CTO
text:
Microsoft   Posted Voodoo Manufacturing raises $1.4 million to make a factory full of 3D printers 
Microsoft announced this morning that it has tapped Kevin Scott as its new Chief Technology Officer. The c-level promotion is an expansion of Scott’s current role as Senior Vice President of Infrastructure at LinkedIn, a move designed to “drive strategic, cross-company initiatives” between the business social networking platform and its parent, according to Microsoft. 
Scott will remain a part of LinkedIn’s executive management team in his new role, while reporting directly to CEO Satya Nadella. Prior to joining up with LinkedIn in 2011, Scott had been employed at a number of key tech companies, including two rounds with Google, the second of which came when the search giant giant picked up AdMob in 2011. 
He has also been associated with Pinterest and served as an Angel Investor to startups like LiveLoop, acquired by Microsoft in 2015. 
Here’s Nadella on the promotion, 
We are thrilled that Kevin will bring to Microsoft his unique expertise developing platforms and services that empower people and organizations. Kevin’s first area of focus is to bring together the world’s leading professional network and professional cloud.”
